references.paper_title: Lecture notes on optimal transport problems
references.reason: This book provides a foundational mathematical treatment of optimal transport, which is the core theoretical underpinning of the research presented in the paper.

references.paper_title: Tutorial on amortized optimization for learning to optimize over continuous domains
references.reason: This work explores the challenge of efficiently computing optimal transport plans, which is directly addressed and improved upon by the methods proposed in the paper.

references.paper_title: Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sinkhorn algorithm, a widely used method for approximating optimal transport that is frequently compared against in the paper's experimental evaluation.
This work focuses on the Wasserstein-2 benchmark that is used in the paper for comparing the performance of different neural optimal transport methods.
This book is a comprehensive overview of optimal transport theory, which is fundamental to understanding the theoretical background and various approaches to optimal transport discussed in the paper.
